items: The creature and its equipment weigh one eighth as much as normal. Items gain or lose this effect when the creature picks up or drops them respectively.
The creature counts as one size smaller for the purpose of mounting other creatures or being moved by spells, effects and other creatures.

When the creature falls, it takes {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it falls rather than {@dice 1d6}. Alternatively, if you are using the {@variantrule variant fall damage|J:General} rules, the creature counts as one size smaller for the purpose of calculating damage from falling.
If the creature gains the {@condition weighted|J:General} condition, both conditions cancel each other out and the creature is treated as having neither until one is removed.
The creature and its equipment weigh eight times as much as normal. Items gain or lose this effect when the creature picks up or drops them respectively.
The creature counts as one size larger for the purpose of mounting other creatures or being moved by spells, effects and other creatures.

When the creature falls, it takes {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it falls rather than {@dice 1d6}. Alternatively, if you are using the {@variantrule variant fall damage|J:General} rules, the creature counts as one size larger for the purpose of calculating damage from falling.
If the creature gains the {@condition lightened|J:General} condition, both conditions cancel each other out and the creature is treated as having neither until one is removed.

condition.name: Bleeding
entries: The creature has sustained an injury or similar effect that is causing them to lose a lot of blood or ichor. The DM might decide that a creature that does not rely on blood or ichor, such as an undead, a construct or an incorporeal elemental, is immune to this condition.

items: At the start of each of its turns, the creature takes slashing damage equal to the Proficiency Bonus of the creature that imposed the condition. If that creature's Proficiency Bonus changes, such as with the {@spell polymorph|phb} spell, this condition continues to use the bonus at the time the condition was imposed.
The condition can be removed with a Medicine check (DC 10 + the imposing creature's Proficiency Bonus) or by magical healing.

condition.name: Sundered
entries: The creature's Armor Class cannot benefit from nonmagical armor or shields. If the armor would limit a creature's ability to add its Dexterity modifier to its Armor Class or impose disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, it still does. For example, a creature with a Dexterity modifer of +3 that is wearing {@item scale mail|phb}, their AC becomes 12.

items: The creature's Armor Class cannot include its Dexterity Modifier (unless it is negative).
The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity checks and saving throws.

feat.name: Tinkerer
entries: You are a talented craftsman, able to create contraptions beyond common understanding, you gain the following benefits:

items: You learn two {@filter artificer infusions|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=AI} of your choice from the artificer class (these are added to any existing artificer infusions you know from any other source).  Whenever you gain a level, you can replace one of these Artificer Infusion options with another one from the artificer class.

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch a nonmagical object and imbue it with one of your artificer infusions (if you can already infuse items, the number of items you can have infused at once is increased by one).

feat.name: Hoplite
entries: You adopt the fighting style of the hoplite, with {@item spear|phb} and {@item shield|phb}. You gain the following benefits:

items: When using a {@item spear|phb} in one hand and a {@item shield|phb} in the other, the weapon's damage die changes as if you wielded the weapon in two hands, from a {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8}. (This benefit has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die.)
Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with spears.
When an ally within 5 feet of you is attacked, you can use your reaction to grant them a +2 bonus to AC against the triggering attack. You must be wielding a {@item shield|phb} to use this feature.

feat.name: Pit Fighter
entries: You have adopted a flashly fighting style that always goes down well with the arena crowds. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you make a weapon attack against a creature, you can use your bonus action gain a bonus to the attack and damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Blood Mage Initiate
entries: You can harness the power of your own blood to enhance your spells. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you cast a spell that restores hit points or deals damage to creatures other than you, you can roll {@dice 2d4} and add the number rolled as a bonus to the hit points regained or the damage dealt. You take necrotic damage equal to the number rolled, which can't be reduced in any way.

When you finish a short rest, you can choose to recover expended spell slots. None of the slots can be 6th level or higher and you take necrotic damage equal to five times the combined level of the spell slots, which can't be reduced in any way.

feat.name: Throwing Weapon Master
entries: You have mastered the art of throwing weapons. You gain the following benefits:

items: Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls when using a weapon with the thrown property.
You can add your proficiency bonus to any ranged attack rolls when using a weapon with the thrown property even if you are not normally proficient with that weapon.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

feat.name: Whipmaster
entries: You have mastered the art of using whips. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you wield a {@item whip|phb}, its damage die changes from a {@dice d4} to a {@dice d6}. (This benefit has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die.)
Whips gain the Light property while you wield them.

When you hit creature within 5ft of you with an attack using a whip, you can use your bonus action to take the {@action Grapple} action against that creature. While you have a creature grappled in this way, you cannot use the whip for any other actions.

feat.name: Angelic Healer
entries: The divine energy within you has grown stronger. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can use your Healing Hands trait as either a bonus action or an action.
You can use your Healing Hands trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all uses upon finishing a long rest.
When you use an action to heal a creature with your Healing Hands trait, the creature regains an additional {@dice 2d4} hitpoints.

feat.name: Angelic Revelation
entries: The divine energy within you has grown stronger. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can use your Celestial Revelation trait again after finishing a short or long rest. In addtion, when you finish a short or long rest, you can change your Celestial Revelation for a different one.

When you use the Necrotic Shroud or Radiant Consumption revelation, the range is 15ft, rather than 10ft. In addition, when you use the Radiant Soul revelation, your speed is increased by 10ft for the duration of your transformation.

When you, or a creature you can see within 5ft is targeted by an attack roll and you are using your Celestial Revelation trait, you can use a reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll as you obscure the targeted creature with your light or wings.

entries: {@note This feat was designed for use with the {@race aasimar|mpmm} race from Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse. It may require adjustment to work with older versions of the race.}

feat.name: Magic Initiate (Variant)
entries: You learn two cantrips and one 1st-level spell of your choice. You can cast the chosen 1st-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).

feat.name: Chef (Revised)
entries: Time spent mastering the culinary arts has paid off, granting you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with {@item cook's utensils|phb} if you don't already have it. If you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, you can also use these tools as a spellcasting focus.

When you use Cook's Utensils to prepare meals during a short rest, creatures of your choice regain additional hit points equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) per Hit Die spent rather than 1. In addition, each creature that consumes the food gains temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

You can use various kitchen implements as simple weapons or shields, as agreed with your DM. For example, you might use a rolling pin as a {@item club|phb}, a cleaver as a {@item handaxe|phb} or a frying pan as a {@item shield|phb}.

feat.name: Gunsmith
entries: You have learned how to efficiently create and modify firearms. You gain the following benefits:

items: It takes you half the usual time and gold to craft firearms and bullets.

You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb} if you don't already have it. During a long rest you can use smith's tools and expend 100gp worth of materials to {@item rifled firearm|J:Firearms|rifle a firearm} or to produce a {@item firearm scope|J:Firearms}.

At the end of each long rest, with smith's tools in your hand, you can touch one non-magical firearm to grant it a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. This benefit lasts until the end of your next long rest.

feat.name: Volatile Spit
entries: Your spit attacks are stronger than most. You gain the following benefits:

items: Both the normal range and long range of your spit attack are doubled.
The damage die for your spit attack increases from a {@dice d4} to a {@dice d6}.
You can use a bonus action to build up acidic saliva before spitting it. The next time you hit a target with your spit attack within the next minute, you deal an additional {@dice 1d6} acid damage.

feat.name: Tohoran Magic
entries: You learn to incorporate the songs and customs of your people into your magic. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn one of the following cantrips of your choice; {@spell druidcraft|phb}, {@spell frostbite|phb}, {@spell thunderclap|phb} or {@spell shape water|phb}. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this cantrip (choose when you gain this feat).
You can use a shell and a handful of saltwater or squid ink as a spellcasting focus for spells you cast.

When you cast a spell with verbal components and that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can double the range of the spell. You can do so a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Tohoran Horn
entries: You grow one or more spear like horns or tusks, or learn to properly utilise existing ones. You gain the following benefits:

items: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You can use a horn to make an unarmed strike. This attack has the reach property and you can use your choice of Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the strike deals piercing damage equal to 1d8 + the ability modifier you used for the attack roll, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

You can use your horn to deflect and parry incoming attacks. When a creature makes a melee weapon attack against you, you can use a reaction to roll a {@dice 1d6} and add the result to your Armor Class for the attack. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Kobold Enhancement
entries: Your innate abilities grow stronger, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain one additional legacy option from your race's description. You cannot choose a legacy option you already have.

feat.name: Oceanid Warrior
entries: You learn the fighting style of the Oceanids. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you wield a {@item trident|phb} or {@item bident|cyranos}, its damage die changes from a {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8} when wielded in one hand, and from a {@dice d8} to a {@dice d10} when wielded with two hands. (This benefit has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die.)
When you make a melee attack with a {@item trident|phb} or {@item bident|cyranos} against a creature while either of you are underwater, you gain advantage on the attack roll.
Your reach with {@item trident|phb|tridents} or {@item bident|cyranos|bidents} with which you are proficient is increased by 5 feet.

feat.name: Hardy Flesh
entries: Your mineral flesh becomes even more resilient and defensive. The raw energy flowing through you often reacts violently to unwanted contact. You gain the following benefits:

items: Increase either your Dexterity or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

While you have temporary hit points from your Mineral Hide trait, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class. Also, if a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these temporary hit points, the creature takes {@dice 1d6} damage of the damage type associated with your Earthen Flesh trait.

feat.name: Variable Flesh
entries: You have learned to greatly alter your mass and size. With a handful of minerals, you can use an action to alter your size and gain one of the effects listed below. The effects last for 10 minutes, or until you lose concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). Once you use this action, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Grow
entries: If you are smaller than Large, you become Large, provided there is enough room for you to do so. If you are already Large, you can instead become Huge, provided there is enough room for you to do so. You also have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws. Once per turn, when you hit a target with a melee attack, you can deal an additional {@dice 1d6} damage of the type associated with your Earthen Flesh trait.

items.name: Shrink
entries: If you are larger than Tiny, you become Tiny. You also have advantage on Dexterity checks and saving throws. Once per turn, when you make a melee attack, you can add a {@dice 1d4} bonus to the attack roll.

feat.name: Renaissance Gaian
entries: You broaden your talents ans skills, becoming a master of several fields, you gain the following benefits:

items: Increase one ability score of your choice, to a maximum of 20.
You gain all of the manifestations options from your Gaian Manifestation trait that you didn't choose when selecting the race.

item.name: Necklace of Beards
entries: While wearing this necklace a creature's beard grows by half an inch after each long rest, even if they could not normally grow a beard.

item.name: Ring of Theatrics
entries: While wearing this ring, you can cast {@spell thaumaturgy|phb} as an action.

item.name: Ring of Tricks
entries: While wearing this ring, you can cast {@spell prestidigitation|phb} as an action.

item.name: Gloves of the Gardener
entries: While wearing these gloves, you can cast {@spell druidcraft|phb} as an action.

item.name: Shield Strap
entries: This leather strap can be used to hang a {@item shield|phb} from your shoulder. When using it in this manner, you may don or doff the shield as a bonus action rather than an action.

item.name: Buckler
entries: This small shield is made from wood or metal and is strapped to the forearm, leaving the hand free. Wielding a buckler increases your Armor Class by 1. You can benefit from only one shield or buckler at a time. You cannot use weapons with the two handed property while wielding this buckler.

item.name: Boots of Dramatic Hovering
entries: These boots allow you to hover dramatically up to 1 foot above the ground as a bonus action. Whilst hovering, you move as if you were walking. The boots do not grant you a flying speed or any protection from terrain, falls or traps.

item.name: Scroll of Unique Wish
entries: This scroll allows a creature to cast the {@spell wish|phb} spell. In addition to the usual drawbacks of the spell, if the creature's wish has ever been wished before, the wish fails and instead summons an {@creature avatar of death|dmg} that is hostile to the creature. The Dungeon Master decides if the wish is unique. Whether the wish suceeds or fails, the scroll burns up and can't be used again.

item.name: Temporal Gearbox
entries: This set of incrementally larger gears connected to a crank can be used to imprison a creature in a slower timestream. As an action you can point this device at a creature and turn the crank, forcing the creature to make a DC12 Wisdom saving throw. On a fail, the creature's perception of time is slowed to the speed where a single heartbeat takes a year (one round in combat takes 6 years).

The creature can act normally but only at their usual speed, even a quick action such as blinking can appear to take weeks or even months. For this reason, this device is commonly used as a torture device. The Dungeon Master decides how this experience affects the creature; rolling for one or more {@variantrule Madness|dmg} effects would be appropriate.

On subsequent turns, you can use an action to continue turning the crank, keeping the effect going. Otherwise, the effect lasts until the start of your next turn. At the end of each of it's turns, the creature can attempt to make the wisdom saving throw again, breaking free on a success. Once a creature has succeeded on a saving throw, it cannot be affected by this item again for 7 days.

item.name: Anti-Magic Collar
entries: This silver collar can be clasped onto a creature that has a neck and is {@condition incapacitated} as an action. While the clasp is shut, the creature cannot cast any spells.

The collar cannot be removed by changing size or shape, such as with the {@spell polymorph|phb} spell. Provided it has two hands free to do so, the creature can use an action on each of its turns to make a DC 15 Strength check. On a success, the collar is broken and becomes non-magical. On a fail, the creature gains a level of exhaustion and the collar remains.

item.name: Cruel Anti-Magic Collar
entries: This special {@item Anti-Magic Collar|J:General} can be clasped onto a creature that has a neck and is {@condition incapacitated} as an action. While the clasp is shut, the creature cannot cast any spells. If it attempts to do so, it takes {@dice 1d6} lightning damage per level of the spell ({@dice 1d6} for cantrips).

The collar cannot be removed by changing size or shape, such as with the {@spell polymorph|phb} spell. Provided it has two hands free to do so, the creature can use an action on each of its turns to make a DC 18 Strength check. On a success, the collar is broken and becomes non-magical. On a fail, the creature gains a level of exhaustion and the collar remains.

item.name: Shield of Bouncing
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
In additon to a simple melee weapon, this weapon can be used as a {@item shield|phb}, granting a +2 bonus to your armor class if you are wielding no other shield.
Additionally, when you make a ranged attack using this weapon, the weapon bounces back to your hand after the attack.

item.name: Longshoreman's Hook
entries: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone|phb}. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

item.name: Chronicles of Alvergia
entries: This heavy tome is part of a 12 volume compendium written by Annaleus of Rubin and contains information about the geography, politics, cultures, wildlife, theologies and cultures of the regions within Alvergia. Most versions are written in either common or elvish but versions can exist in most written languages. Each volume is worth about 25gp and covers a specific region in Alvergia, but the entire collection as a set is worth about 1000gp.

When you possess a volume of the book you may ask the DM for a piece of lore relating to the volume's respective region and they may give you some tidbits. For example, you could ask for details regarding a particular god or about the laws and customs of a city. The information should be something that a well researched scholar would know and deem worthy to mention. The DM may decide that a topic is too specific, insignificant or secret to appear in the volumes. They may also decide that a topic is broad enough to require several hours, or even days, of reading to fully understand it.
Below are the regions covered by each volume.

rows: The Pelais Coast and the Feywild
Xia and the Forest of Muhai

item.name: Tome of Many Cheeses
entries: This slightly damp catalogue of different types of cheeses has a funny smell. As an action, you can choose one of the cheeses listed and summon up to 5lbs of that type of cheese in a space adjacent to you. The cheese disappears if it is not consumed within 24 hours. Once you summon cheese, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.
In addition, whenever you find a new form of non-magical cheese, you can spend 10 minutes describing it on a new page in the book. It can then be summoned using the book.

item.name: Assassin's Teapot
entries: This specially designed teapot features two separate compartments that can hold different liquids, such as tea and poison. It also features a pair of secret holes on the handle, with which you to control which liquid is poured by covering specific holes. When you pour from this teapot, choose one or both of the liquids to be poured.
You have advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks made to avoid creatures noticing anything usual about the way you pour the teapot.

item.name: Hydra Blood
entries: This poison must be harvested from a dead or {@condition incapacitated|phb} {@creature hydra|mm}. You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 4d6} poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

item.name: Cloak of Endless Poultry
entries: This feathered cloak holds some form of gateway to a demi plane full of chickens. The cloak has 5 charges, it regains {@dice 1d6-1} charges daily at dawn.

As an action you can expend a charge and open the cloak and {@dice 1d4} {@creature chicken|J:General|chickens} fall out into adjacent spaces. The chickens are friendly to you and your allies, they will follow you and may attack any creatures or objects that attack you but are otherwise unable to understand any commands you make. The chickens last for 1 hour or until they die, after which they either enter the cloak again or disappear in a puff of feathers.

item.name: Nautical Bone Charm
entries: This broken bone is inscribed with arcane runes and has 5 charges. It regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges daily at dawn.

As an action, you can expend a number of charges to cast the {@spell Spectral Crew|J:General} spell. For 1 charge, you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

item.name: +1 Pugilist Bracers
entries: While wearing these leather bracers, you have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes.
In addition, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

item.name: +2 Pugilist Bracers
entries: While wearing these leather bracers, you have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes.
In addition, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

item.name: +3 Pugilist Bracers
entries: While wearing these leather bracers, you have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes.
In addition, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

item.name: Bottle of Delights
entries: This clear, glass bottle can hold up to a gallon of liquid. When there is liquid in the bottle, you may cast {@spell Bazoz's Spicy Water|J:General} on the liquid at will.
If you pour the liquid out of the bottle, the effects remain active in the liquid for 1 hour, or until you use the bottle to cast the cantrip again.

item.name: Brine Poison
entries: This poison is harvested from brine pools deep underwater, the extreme salinity is toxic to most creatures. You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 2d4} poison damage and become {@condition incapacitated|phb} until the end of its next turn. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.
At the DM's discretion, if a creature is not acclimated to high salinity environments, they have disadvantge on the saving throw and take double the poison damage on a fail.

item.name: Silent Hammer
entries: This small, metal hammer produces no noise when used to strike something. The object or creature struck with the hammer also produces no noise as a result of the striking.

item.name: Magic Eyeliner
entries: This eyeliner is imbued with magic powders that grant the wearer benefits for a short duration. As an action, you can apply the eyeliner to a creature. That creature has truesight out to 60ft for the next 8 hours, after which the eyeliner ceases to be magical.

item.name: Ring of False Death
entries: This dark metal ring is popular with spies and criminals. When you take damage, you can use a reaction to cast the {@spell feign death|phb} spell on yourself without providing material components. Once you do so, you can not do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Body Modder's Tools
additionalEntries: Proficiency with body modder's tools represents your ability to safely modify a creature's body with grafts, implants, piercings, scarification and tattoos. You also acquire an understanding of the history and symbolism of body modifications, which can aid you in producing and examining them.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: This kit includes needles, syringes, scalpels, gauze and small bottles of various dyes, inks, disinfectants and other chemicals.

additionalEntries.name: Arcana
entries: You gain additional insight when identifying the materials and patterns used in magic tattoos and other modifications.

additionalEntries.name: History and Religion
entries: You have greater understanding of the cultural and religious significance of certain body modifications.

additionalEntries.name: Medicine
entries: You can recognise and treat infections caused by unclean punctures and wounds. You also have better chances of spotting when a creature's appearance has been nonmagically modified, such as implanted horns or dyed skin.

additionalEntries.name: Modify
entries: As part of a long rest, you can expend at least 10gp worth of materials to perform (or reverse) a body modification on a willing creature, such as a tattoo or piercing. The DM may decide that more complex modifications require more valuable materials.

additionalEntries.caption: Body Modder's Tools
rows: Dye, tattoo or scar a creature's fur or skin.
Give a creature a piercing or expander.
Graft or implant horns, scales, spikes, a tail or other decorative body parts.
Slightly alter the shape of a humanoid's facial features.
Make a humanoid appear as a different but similar race, or as a different sex.

item.name: Ring of Folding
entries: This segmented, metal ring has a surprisingly large interior compartment and can be used to hide weapons.
Over the course of 10 minutes, you can magically fold and store a single weapon inside the ring. You can then use a bonus action to unfold the wepon and summon it to your empty hand.

item.name: Voltaic Ball Bearings (bag of 1,000)
entries: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level area 10 feet square. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw. If a creature in the area takes lightning damage, they take an additional {@dice 1d12} lightning damage.
Additionally, while holding the bag, you can use a bonus action to command any balls within 15ft to magically fly back into the bag via the most direct route.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This item is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a spell such as {@spell remove curse} or a similar effect. While cursed, you are filled with an overwhelming urge to put one or more of the ball bearings in your mouth. While you do not have any ball bearings in your mouth, you have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws. While you have at least one ball bearing in your mouth, you are vulnerable to lightning damage. You are unwilling to part with all of the balls until the curse is broken with remove curse or similar magic, keeping at least one ball on your person at all times.

item.name: Gauntlets of the Hurricane
entries: These leather and iron scale gauntlets grant the wielder remarkable strength and control with melee weapons. This item has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d3} charges daily at dawn.
While attuned, you can use a bonus action to expend one charge and gain the following benefits for the next 10 minutes:

items: You can ignore the heavy property and any Strength requirements on melee weapons.
You can wield a melee weapon in one hand as if you were wielding it with two hands.
You can use two-weapon fighting even when the melee weapons you are wielding aren't light or one-handed. You can also add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

item.name: Ki Stone
entries: This jade stone bears a carving resembling a key on one side and one resembling a lock on the other. As an action, you can use this stone to expend 3 Ki points to cast either the {@spell arcane lock|phb} or {@spell knock|phb} spell. You must still provide any material components.

item.name: Ki Focusing Ring
item.reqAttune: by a monk with the spellcasting or pact magic feature
entries: This bimetallic, two-finger ring allows you to focus your Ki into magical reserves, or do the reverse. While attuned, you can use an action and spend 2 or more Ki points to recover an expended spell slot of a level equal to half the number of Ki points expended (rounded up). The recovered spell slot cannot be higher than 5th-level.
Alternatively, you can use an action and expend a spell slot to recover a number of expended Ki points equal to the level of the spell slot expended.

item.name: Boots of Explosive Propulsion
entries: These scorched leather and metal boots grant you extraordinary movement capabilities. This item has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn.

As a bonus action, you can expend a charge and cast the {@spell explosive propulsion|J:General} (save DC 15) spell on yourself, you do not provide material components for this casting. In addition, the spell does not require concentration and lasts for the full duration, or until you end the effect (no action required).

item.name: Spectacles of Glinting
entries: While wearing these spectacles, you can use a bonus action to make them glint stylishly. Some variants of this item may feature tinted glass.

item.name: Pocketplane Locket
entries: This locket contains a small demiplane in which constructs can live. This demiplane can be designed in any way the creator sees fit but can only hold up to six constructs and must be less than 1 mile in any dimension.

As an action you can touch a willing construct and place them inside the demiplane. While inside the locket, a construct's hitpoints cannot be changed and any conditions and effects are halted until the construct leaves the gem. The constructs are aware of the outside world but cannot communicate with any creatures outside.
As an action you can command any number of willing constructs to leave the gem and enter whatever plane the locket is on. They appear in an empty space within 10ft of the locket.

item.name: Potion of the Berserker
entries: This foul concoction is made of mushrooms and other psychoactive herbs, and can make creatures much more aggressive and reckless than they would normally be. When you drink this potion, you gain advantage on melee weapon attacks for 1 minute. Attack rolls against you have advantage for this duration.

item.name: Axe of Felling
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, attacks with this weapon deal double damage against plants and objects made of wood.

This weapon has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with a melee attack using this weapon, you can use a bonus action to expend 1 charge and force the creature to make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a fail, the creature is subjected to the effects of the {@spell timber|J:General} spell. You decide direction of the cone (originating from the target) and the space that the creature reappears in when the spell ends.

item.name: Belt of Swagger
entries: While wearing this fashionable belt, you instinctively walk with a cool and confident stride.

item.name: Tome of Body Modder's Tools
entries: This book contains knowledge and instructions for body modification. If you spend 24 hours studying the book's contents (this can be done as light activity during a long rest), you can make a DC 10 Intelligence check. On a success, you gain proficiency with {@item body modder's tools|J:General}. On a fail, you must spend a further 12 hours studying the book to attempt the check again.

item.name: Robe of the Desert
entries: This lightweight beige or tan robe can be worn with light or medium armor. The loose cloth around the shoulders can be formed into a simple hood and face mask, protecting the wearer from the elements. The many folds and creases of the robe seem to hold a small yet endless quantity of sand that gets everywhere.
While attuned to this robe, you are resistant to fire damage and have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in sandy terrain.
The robe has 10 charges, it regains {@dice 1d10} charges daily at dawn. If you have spent the entire previous day wearing the robe in a hot desert, it regains an additional 2 charges at dawn.

You can expend up to 3 charges to cast one of the following spells (save DC 16) without providing material components: {@spell mold earth|xge}, {@spell gust|xge}, {@spell color spray|phb}, {@spell cloud of daggers|phb}, {@spell dust devil|xge}, {@spell gust of wind|phb}, {@spell leomund's tiny hut|phb} or {@spell wall of sand|xge}.

The number of charges expended is equal to the level the spell is cast at (no charges required for a cantrip). When cast in this way, each of these spells resembles sand or sandstone in someway. For example, {@spell cloud of daggers|phb} might be a flurry of floating sand and glass shards, while {@spell leomund's tiny hut|phb} might appear to have the color and texture of sandstone from the outside.

Additionally, when a creature with exposed eyes fails a saving throw against one of these spells, you can expend a charge and force them to become {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

item.name: Seed of Whispers
entries: This dark purple seed can hold whispers for later release. You can spend 1 minute to plant the seed in dirt or sand, water it and whisper a phrase to it that lasts 6 seconds or fewer. The seed begins to sprout and becomes a small tree or shrub {@dice 3d6*10|3d6 x 10} days later. Until the tree or shrub dies, whenever the wind blows through its leaves and branches, faint whispers can be heard on the wind, the whispers resemble the phrase you spoke to it during the planting.

item.name: Bag of Holding Grudges
entries: This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate.

Placing a bag of holding inside an extradimensional space created by a {@item Heward's handy haversack}, {@item portable hole}, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

entries.name: Curse
entries: The bag bears a curse and is extremely temperamental. If you offend the bag, it will seal itself shut, completely preventing access to the interior space, until you succeed on a DC 20 Charisma check to apologise to it. If you fail this check, you cannot attempt it again until the next dawn. Casting {@spell remove curse|phb} on the bag will end this effect early. The DM decides when the bag is offended, but typically putting poor quality or disgusting items inside it might offend it, as could removing high quality items. The DM might call for a {@dice d20} to be rolled whenever such items are added or removed from the bag, with a 1 resulting in the bag becoming offended.

item.name: Potion of Polymorph
entries: This blood-like liquid has transformative properties. When you drink this potion, you can cast the {@spell polymorph|phb} spell on yourself.

item.name: Tiefling Heart
entries: In many cultures, consuming humanoid flesh is deeply taboo. Yet, there are still those who do. Whether they acquire them through legal or illegal means, tiefling hearts are something of a delicacy for wealthy consumers.
When a creature consumes this fiery red heart, it takes 1 fire damage.

entries.name: Counterfeit Hearts
entries: Naturally the value of tiefling hearts, and the difficulty of acquiring genuine ones, leads some to attempt to make a quick profit by selling fake hearts. Sometimes hearts from pigs or other humanoids are infused with chilis or {@item alchemist's fire|phb} and sold as tiefling hearts.
These counterfeit hearts are actually worth around {@dice 2d4*5|2d4 x 5}gp, and a creature can determine its fake with a DC14 Wisdom (Medicine) check.

item.name: Lesser Otherform Mask (Aberation)
entries: Taking the form of a mask, helmet or cowl, this headwear can disguise your true nature. While wearing this item, you can use a bonus action to change your creature type to aberation until you use another bonus action to change back to your original type. While you are disguising your creature type in this way, you also have advantage on Charisma checks when interacting with other creatures of the same type. The effects end if you are no longer wearing the headwear.
At the DM's discretion, your appearance might also subtly change to fit your new type. For example, as an aberation, your skin may appear slimy and of a unusual hue.

item.name: Lesser Otherform Mask (Beast)
entries: Taking the form of a mask, helmet or cowl, this headwear can disguise your true nature. While wearing this item, you can use a bonus action to change your creature type to beast until you use another bonus action to change back to your original type. While you are disguising your creature type in this way, you also have advantage on Charisma checks when interacting with other creatures of the same type. The effects end if you are no longer wearing the headwear.
At the DM's discretion, your appearance might also subtly change to fit your new type. For example, as a beast, you may become covered in fur, feathers, scales or chitin.

entries: Taking the form of a mask, helmet or cowl, this headwear can disguise your true nature. While wearing this item, you can use a bonus action to change your creature type to plant until you use another bonus action to change back to your original type. While you are disguising your creature type in this way, you also have advantage on Charisma checks when interacting with other creatures of the same type. The effects end if you are no longer wearing the headwear.

At the DM's discretion, your appearance might also subtly change to fit your new type. For example, as a plant, your skin might take on a bark like texture or your hair might be replaced by leaves and vines.

item.name: Lesser Otherform Mask (Undead)
entries: Taking the form of a mask, helmet or cowl, this headwear can disguise your true nature. While wearing this item, you can use a bonus action to change your creature type to undead until you use another bonus action to change back to your original type. While you are disguising your creature type in this way, you also have advantage on Charisma checks when interacting with other creatures of the same type. The effects end if you are no longer wearing the headwear.
At the DM's discretion, your appearance might also subtly change to fit your new type. For example, as an undead, you might appear more gaunt with dried skin and sparse hair.

item.name: Greater Otherform Mask
entries: Taking the form of a mask, helmet or cowl, this headwear can disguise your true nature. While wearing this headwear, you can use a bonus action to change your creature type to a different one of your choice until you use another bonus action to change to another type or back to your original type. While you are disguising your creature type in this way, you also have advantage on Charisma checks when interacting with other creatures of the same type. The effects end if you are no longer wearing the headwear.

At the DM's discretion, your appearance might also subtly change to fit your new type. For example, as a celestial, your eyes or hair might turn white or gold and even faintly glow. While, as an undead, you might appear more gaunt with dried skin and sparse hair.

item.name: Phoenix Feather
entries: This red and orange feather can be consumed in place of up to 300gp worth of material components when casting a spell that deals fire damage, creates light or brings a creature back to life, but not undeath.

item.name: Phoenix Eggshell
entries: This red and orange eggshell is always warm to to touch. Striking two fragments of the eggshell together creates a flurry of sparks, much like a flint and steel.

With at least half the eggshell intact, you can use it as a cup for beverages. Beverages that spend at least one minute in the eggshell become warm and slightly spiced, such as cider becoming mulled cider

item.name: Feathered Pauldrons
entries: While wearing these pauldrons, you have the {@condition lightened|J:General} condition.

item.name: Weighted Anklets
entries: WWhile wearing these metallic anklets, you have the {@condition weighted|J:General} condition.

item.name: Potion of the Lightweight
entries: When you drink this light, foamy potion, you become {@condition lightened|J:General} for one hour.

item.name: Potion of the Heavyweight
entries: When you drink this thick, metallic potion, you become {@condition weighted|J:General} for one hour.

item.name: Densweeties
entries: This tin box contains up to 12 sweets when found. {@dice 2d4+1} of the sweets are light and fluffy, the rest are hard and dense. When you eat one of the light sweets, you gain the {@condition lightened|J:General} condition. When you eat one of the hard sweets, you gain the {@condition weighted|J:General} condition. Either way, the condition lasts for 1 hour or until you eat another sweet from the tin.

item.name: Runestone Bracelet
entries: This bracelet can be fused with a weapon runestone, granting the benefits of the runestone to your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Runestone Brooch
entries: This brooch can be fused with an armor runestone, granting the benefits of the runestone to a set of clothes, robes or a piece of jewelry.

item.name: +1 Juggling Runestone

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d6-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature that is your size or smaller with a melee attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to force the creature to make a DC 16 Strength saving throw. On a fail, both you and the target are launched 15 feet vertically without provoking opportunity attacks. You can choose to have the pair of you launched diagonally, up to 10ft horizontally, you and target must move in the same direction. Neither of you fall until the end of your turn unless you choose to. Subsequent melee attacks you make with this weapon against the creature before you both fall have advantage.

item.name: +1 Bloody Runestone

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon always appears to be covered in wet blood, and cannot be cleaned of it. While attuned to the weapon, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks against creatures that can see the weapon.

item.name: +1 Glimmering Runestone

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon always appears clean and freshly polished with a satisfying sheen. While attuned to the weapon, you have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks against creatures that can see the weapon.

item.name: +1 Charming Runestone

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon constantly emits an inaudible resonance that hinders creatures abilities to determine falsehoods. While attuned to the weapon, you have advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks against creatures that can see the weapon and are not {@condition deafened}.

item.name: +1 Distracting Runestone

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, when you hit a target with this weapon or fire a piece of ammunition from this weapon you can cause the target or ammunition to produce one of the following effects until the start of your next turn.

items: The target or ammunition sheds bright light out to a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.
The target or ammunition emits a whistling noise that can be heard up to 60ft.

item.name: +1 Glamour Runestone

entries.name: Armor Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a set of armor or a shield, turning it into a magic item, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a set of armor that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, unless it is magic armor that already grants a bonus to Armor Class.

Additionally, you can use a bonus action to alter the colors, sigils and patterns of the armor or to magically clean, dry or soil the armor. As part of the same bonus action, you can all alter any nonmagical clothing you are wearing in the same way. The armor or clothing retains its shape, materials and statistics and the effect ends if you use this bonus action again or you doff it. For example, you may alter a dirty brown tabbard into pristine red and white one bearing the sigil of a particular deity or noble.

item.name: +1 Stubborn Runestone

entries.name: Armor Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a set of armor or a shield, turning it into a magic item, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a set of armor that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, unless it is magic armor that already grants a bonus to Armor Class.

Additionally, the armor fills your mind with stubborn voices, warning you against manipulitive effects. While attuned, you have advantage on saving throws to avoid or remove the {@condition charmed} condition.

item.name: +1 Bolstering Runestone

entries.name: Armor Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a set of armor or a shield, turning it into a magic item, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a set of armor that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, unless it is magic armor that already grants a bonus to Armor Class.

Additionally, the armor fills your mind with reassuring voices, helping you maintain your courage. While you wear the armor, you have advantage on saving throws to avoid or remove the {@condition frightened} condition.

item.name: +1 Rooting Runestone

entries.name: Armor Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a set of armor or a shield, turning it into a magic item, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a set of armor that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, unless it is magic armor that already grants a bonus to Armor Class.

Additionally, when you would be moved against your will, you can use a reaction to rapidly grow roots, spikes or hooks to hold you in place. Until the start of your next turn, your speed is 0 and you cannot be moved against your will. You must be touching a solid surface capable of supporting your weight, such as the ground or a wall, to use this reaction. This effect does not prevent teleportation and ends early if the surface you are touching is destroyed or moved away from you.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Acid)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon constantly bears a wet sheen, as if recently dipped in liquid. It also slightly stings to touch the blade or head. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to acid, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature or object with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to spray additional acid onto the target. At the start of each of it's turns, the creature or object takes {@dice 1d6} acid damage. The effect lasts 1 minute, or until the target, or a creature within 5 feet of it, uses an action to clean off the remaining acid.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Bludgeoning)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon becomes noticeably bulkier and heavier, but not so much that it impairs it's usage. it the weapon previously had sharp edges, they appear dulled. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to bludgeoning, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature or object with an attack using this weapon, and the target is composed primarily of solid, inorganic matter, such as stone, metal or crystal, you can expend a charge to deal double bludgeoning damage to the target.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Cold)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon always appears to bear a light coating of frost and emit a thin cold mist. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to cold, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to impose a {@dice 1d6} penalty on the target's next Dexterity check or saving throw before the end of its next turn.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Fire)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon always appears to faintly glow as if extremely hot. it may also emit faint embers or small flames. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to fire, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature or object with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to deal an additional {@dice 2d6} fire damage to the target.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Force)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon always appears slightly transparent, as if made of magic rather than matter. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to force, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you make an attack with this weapon, you can expend a charge to increase its range or reach for the attack. For a ranged attack, the long range is increased by 30 feet and attacking at long range does not impose disadvantage on the attack roll. For a melee attack the reach is increased by 5 feet.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Lightning)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon constantly crackles and sparks with lightning. The area immediately surrounding the weapon always appears to have unusual levels of static. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to lightning, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature or object with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to create an arc of lighting to an additional target of your choice within 10 feet of the original target, provided the original attack roll can hit it. The second target takes {@dice 2d6} lightning damage.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Necrotic)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon emits a faint and ominous dark smoke. Occasionally, when it damages a creature, drinking noises can be heard. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to necrotic, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, and that creature is not a construct or undead, you can expend a charge to gain {@dice 2d6} temporary hit points. The creature also cannot regain hit points until the end of its next turn.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Piercing)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon has usually sharp points and edges, even if it didn't before. These points and edges appear far thinner that should physically be possible with typical weapon materials. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to piercing, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you make an attack with this weapon against a creature that is wearing armor or wielding a shield, you can expend a charge to gain a +5 bonus to the attack roll. This attack roll also scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or higher.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Poison)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon always appears to be coated in a dark, oily liquid. This liquid is extremely bitter if tasted. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to poison, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to force the creature to make a DC16 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success. A creature that fails the saving throw but is immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition instead has disadvantage on its next ability or attack roll.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Psychic)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon constantly emits faint whispers and eerie songs, often in ancient undecipherable languages. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to psychic, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to force the creature to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the weapon for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Radiant)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon constantly emits a faint radiant glow. Sometimes a soothing choir can be heard from the weapon that brings comfort to non evil creatures nearby. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to radiant, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to restore {@dice 1d8} hit points to a creature of your choice within 10 feet of the original target. Alternatively, you can choose to deal {@dice 1d8} radiant damage to an undead or fiend creature within 10 feet of the original target (this can include the target). The weapon also emits 10 feet of bright light until the start of your next turn.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Slashing)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon gains a number of serrations and barbs on its blades, heads or points. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to slashing, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, and that creature is not a construct or undead, you can expend a charge to give the target a debilitating wound. Until the end of its next turn, the creature takes {@dice 1d6} slashing damage for every 5 feet it moves.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Thunder)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, noises produced by this weapon are noticeably louder and reverberate more than they naturally should. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to thunder, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature or object with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to push the target 15 feet away from you. If the target is Huge or larger, or is a creature that succeeds on a DC16 Strength saving throw, they are only pushed 5 feet. If this movement would force the target into the space of a creature or object that is its size or larger, both targets take {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage and the target stops moving.

item.name: Homing Ink Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features a series of runic sigils. Each sigil corresponds to a particular teleportation circle that you know. Whenever you commit a circle's sigil to memory, the sigil is added to the design of this tattoo.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Stored Circles.}} You can use this tattoo to cast the {@spell teleportation circle} spell without expending a spell slot (you must still provide the material components). Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Springstep Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features a coil like pattern rising up your ankles and calves.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Eldritch Leap.}} You can use this tattoo to cast the {@spell jump} spell on yourself as a bonus action without expending a spell slot. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Strong Grip Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features muscle like patterns.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Robust Grasp.}} While attuned to this item and wielding a weapon with the Versatile property in one hand, the weapon's damage die changes as if you wielded the weapon in two hands. (This benefit has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die.)

item.name: Loyalty Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features twisting and looping patterns.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Bonded Weapon.}} You can perform a ritual to bond with a weapon you touch over the course of an hour, this can be done during a short rest. You can only bond to one weapon at a time. So long as the bonded weapon is within 60ft of you, you can use a bonus action to summon it to your hand via the most direct route.
Any creatures that would be hit by the weapon on its path to your hand, must make a DC12 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} of the weapon's damage type.

item.name: Burning Fist Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features glowing flame like patterns.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Magical Strikes.}} While the tattoo is on your skin, your unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with unarmed strikes.

{@b {@i Flaming Punch.}} This tattoo has 6 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d6} charges daily at dawn. As a bonus action, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell searing smite|phb} spell without expending a spell slot. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. For 2 charges, you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell. The effects of the spell only apply to your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Wild Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features a chaotic and colourful pattern that never seems to look the same each time you look at it.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Chaotic Reserves.}} As an action you can roll {@dice 1d6-1} and recover expended spell slots with a combined level that is equal to or less than the result of the roll. If the result is a 0, you must instead roll a Wild Magic Surge. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Subdermal Chain Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features spiralling patterns of chains, ropes, vines or webs.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Chain Weapon.}} While the tattoo is on your skin, you can summon a chain to your free hand as a bonus action, or as part of an attack you make with the chain. You can dismiss the chain again as a bonus action. You cannot be disarmed of the chain.

The chain is a simple melee weapon with the finesse and reach properties. On a hit, it deals bludgeoning or slashing (your choice) damage equal to {@dice 1d8} plus the ability modifier you used for the attack roll. The chain counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
Alternatively, when you summon the chain, you can attach it to a melee weapon that lacks the two-handed or heavy property. The weapon gains the reach property while the chain is attached.

item.name: Arcane Enhancement Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo can enhance your abilities. Choose an ability, when you get this tattoo, your chosen ability score is permanently increased by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 22 using this tattoo.

item.name: Ink Tether Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features the design of a dart or arrow on the hand with the image of a rope or chain tightly coiled up the forearm.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Assisted Grasp.}} When you take the {@action Grapple} or {@action Shove} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to gain advantage on the Strength (Athletics) check as a spectral rope extends from the tattoo, wrapping around the target.

{@b {@i Far Reach.}} As a bonus action, you can cast the {@spell runner's rope|J:General} spell without expending a spell slot or providing material components. Once you use this bonus action, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Firearm Bullet
entries: This paper cartridge contains a basic lead bullet and a precise measure of black powder for optimal usage with most firearms.

item.name: Piercing Bullet
entries: This paper cartridge contains a specially designed lead bullet and a precise measure of black powder for optimal usage with most firearms.

You gain a +5 bonus to attack rolls made with this piece of specialised ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is destroyed. If the target is a creature, you subtract {@dice 1d4+1} from the attack's damage roll (to a minimum of 1).

item.name: Fragmentation Bullet
entries: This paper cartridge contains a specially designed lead bullet and a precise measure of black powder for optimal usage with most firearms.

You take a -5 penalty to attack rolls made with this piece of specialised ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is destroyed. If the target is a creature, you add a {@dice 1d4+1} bonus to the attack's damage roll.

item.name: Bullet Pouch
entries: This pouch can hold up to 20 {@item sling bullet|phb|sling bullets}, {@item firearm bullet|J:Firearms|firearm bullets}, {@item piercing bullet|J:Firearms|piercing bullets} or {@item fragmentation bullet|J:Firearms|fragmentation bullets}. The pouch weighs 1 pound, regardless of its contents. Drawing a bullet from the pouch does not require an action.

item.name: Bottomless Bullet Pouch
entries: This pouch can hold up to 20 {@item sling bullet|phb|sling bullets}, {@item firearm bullet|J:Firearms|firearm bullets}, {@item piercing bullet|J:Firearms|piercing bullets} or {@item fragmentation bullet|J:Firearms|fragmentation bullets}. The pouch weighs 1 pound, regardless of its contents. Drawing a bullet from the pouch does not require an action.

Additionally, You can place a nonmagical bullet in the pouch. From then on, whenever the bullet is removed, a perfect duplicate is created inside the pouch, effectively providing an unlimited supply of that particular bullet. As an action, you can permanently remove a bullet, preventing it from creating any further duplicates.

item.name: Firearm Scope
entries: This set of carefully crafted lenses makes aiming at long range easier. You can spend 10 minutes afixing this scope to a firearm with the Two-Handed property, after which attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with this weapon. This does not have any effect on firearms with the Wide-Shot property.

item.name: Bayonet
entries: This blade can be fixed to any firearm with the Two-Handed property as an action. The blade can then be used to make a melee weapon attack as part of an {@action attack} action. This attack has the Finese property. On a hit, this attack deals {@dice 1d4} piercing damage.

item.name: Pepperbox Pistol
entries: {@b {@i Multi-Barrel.}} When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to make an additional attack with this weapon. This attack ignores the loading property of this weapon.

item.name: Pepperbox Musket
