entries: {@b {@i Multi-Barrel.}} When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to make an additional attack with this weapon. This attack ignores the loading property of this weapon.

item.name: Duckfoot Pistol
entries: This advanced firearm design features several barrels placed at different angles alongside each other, resembling a duck's foot. When the trigger is pulled, all barrels fire simultaneously casting a wide arc of bullets.

{@b {@i Wide-Shot.}} When you make an attack with this weapon, you do not target a single creature. Instead every creature within a 30ft cone originating from the weapon must make a Dexterity saving throw, or take the damage of this weapon. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Dexterity bonus + your proficiency bonus if you are proficient with this weapon. This action uses five pieces of ammunition.

item.name: Blunderbuss
entries: This advanced firearm design features a wide flared barrel in which multiple bullets can fit. When the trigger is pulled, all bullets are fired simultaneously.

{@b {@i Improvised-Ammunition.}} This weapon can be loaded with any ten tiny objects, such as gravel or ball bearings. When you do so, any creature targeted by an attack from this weapon has advantage on the saving throw to avoid being hit. The damage for this kind of attack is {@dice 1d4}.

{@b {@i Wide-Shot.}} When you make an attack with this weapon, you do not target a single creature. Instead every creature within a 30ft cone originating from the weapon must make a Dexterity saving throw, or take the damage of this weapon. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Dexterity bonus + your proficiency bonus if you are proficient with this weapon. This action uses five pieces of ammunition.

item.name: Wheelchair
entries: This contraption grants mobility to those who may be impaired due to injuries, disabilities or curses.
{@b {@i Size.}} Your wheelchair is designed for you and is the same size as you. If a magic effect or spell changes your size, the chair changes with you.

{@b {@i Speed.}} While sitting in a wheelchair, you effectively have a base walking speed of 30ft, regardless of your race. If a magic effect or spell changes your walking speed, your speed in the chair also changes. If you have a climb, swim or fly speeds, these are not affected by the chair. Seatbelts ensure that the chair comes with you however you move.
{@b {@i Poor Mobility.}} Terrain that is not flat and firm, such as mud or sand, is considered {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

{@b {@i Gravity.}} Travelling up steep inclines or stairs counts as {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for you when in the chair. When travelling down steep inclines or stairs, you can travel 2 feet for every 1 foot of movement used.
{@b {@i Magic Effects and Features.}} The wheelchair is considered part of you for the purposes of magic effects, features, items or spells, any effects on you also affect the chair.

{@b {@i Upgrading the Wheelchair.}} Using a set of {@item tinker's tools|phb} over 1 hour, a creature can afix, or remove, wheelchair upgrades. A wheelchair cannot have more than four upgrades at once. If a wheelchair has multiple upgrades that require attunement, you may treat the wheelchair as a single item for the purposes of attunement.

entries.name: Handsfree Variant
entries: If you also have limited use of your hands and arms, the DM may allow you a specialised chair that allows you to replicate the functions of hands.

You have telepathic control over one or two pseudo hands that function indentically to regular arms and hands. These could be mechanical arms attached to the chair, spectral hands floating around the chair or some other form that you and the DM decide upon. You may use any combination of regular hands and pseudo hands but can not have more than two total at any one time, unless you gain them from another source.

item.name: All-terrain Wheels
entries: This set of wheels come with a kit of spikes, snow chains and special tyres that can be afixed to a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. You can ignore the Poor Mobility property of the wheelchair as the wheels can traverse the terrain as easily as with legs.
This upgrade can not be afixed at the same time as the {@item Racing Wheels|JWC} upgrade.
If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Racing Wheels
entries: This set of lightweight, narrow wheels can be afixed to a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. Your base walking speed is increased by 10ft when not on {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.
This upgrade can not be afixed at the same time as the {@item All-terrain Wheels|JWC} upgrade.
If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Hoverstone
entries: This magic gemstone can be fixed to the armrest of a {@item wheelchair|JWC}, granting you the ability to hover the chair a few inches above the ground. You can use a bonus action to start or stop hovering. While hovering, you ignore the Gravity property of the wheelchair as you glide up and down inclines and stairs.

If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you. Activating or deactivating the stone can be done as part of the same bonus action used to command the chair to move.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Floats
entries: This series of inflable bladders can be used to float the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. As an action you can inflate, or deflate, the bladders to make the chair float on water. While the bladders are inflated, you have a swim speed of 30ft (unless you already have a higher swim speed from another source) and you can not descend underwater but your walking speed is halved.

If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you. You can use an action to telepathically command the bladders to inflate or deflate.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Spider Legs
entries: This foldable set of mechanical spider legs can fit snuggly on the underside of a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. As an action, you can deploy the legs for 1 hour or until you retract them as an action. While the legs are deployed, you gain a climb speed of 30ft (unless you already have a higher climb speed from another source) and ignore the Poor Mobility and Gravity properties of the wheelchair. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you. You can use an action to telepathically command the legs to deploy or retract.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Greater Hoverstone
entries: This magic gemstone can be fixed to the armrest of a {@item wheelchair|JWC}, granting you the ability to make the chair fly. As an action, you can activate the stone for 1 hour or until you deactive it as an action. While the stone is activated, you have a fly speed of 30ft (unless you already have a higher fly speed from another source). Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you. You can use an action to telepathically command the stone to activate or deactivate.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Weapon Mount
entries: This special pivoting mount can be fixed to the armrest of a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. You can spend 1 minute to mount, or remove, a single melee weapon, a {@item light crossbow|phb} or a {@item heavy crossbow|phb}. You can only mount one weapon in this way at once. While mounted, the weapon can be used as normal but does not cost an action to draw or stow the weapon and you cannot be disarmed of the weapon so long as you are in the chair.
{@note If your DM allows, you may also mount firearms using this upgrade.}
If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade and has a melee weapon mounted, you add that weapon's melee attacks to the wheelchair's statblock.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Armored Plates
entries: These heavy plates can offer you some extra cover for a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. While you are in the chair, you gain a +2 to AC.
You also gain disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while in the chair.
If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Ram
entries: This heavy ram can be afixed to front of a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. This can be used as a {@item portable ram|phb}.

Additionally, if you move at least 10 feet in a straight line toward a creature or object that is not larger than you, you can make a special melee weapon attack against them in which you crash into them with the ram. You are proficient with this attack. On a hit, you deal {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength modifier as bludgeoning damage, the target must also make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you. Addtionally, you add the attack granted by this upgrade to the wheelchair's statblock.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Heavy Wheels
entries: These heavy lead wheels can be afixed to a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. When you are within 5 feet of a creature that is not larger than you and {@condition prone|phb}, you can make a special melee weapon attack against them in which you roll over them. You are proficient with this attack. On a hit, you deal {@dice 1d8} plus your Strength modifier as bludgeoning damage. If you are at least one size larger than the creature, you add an addtional {@dice 1d4} to the damage dealt.
If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, you add the attack granted by this upgrade to the wheelchair's statblock.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Remote Beacon
entries: This magic gemstone can be afixed to a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. While attuned, so long as the chair is on the same plane as you, you always know where it is.

If you are not in the chair, it is treated as an {@creature Animated object (Medium)|phb}. It cannot act on its own but, if it is within 100ft of you, you may use a bonus action to telepathically command it to move up to its full movement. Addtionally, you can use an action to command the chair to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Dodge} or {@action Hide} action.
Additional upgrades afixed to this wheelchair may grant further actions, see respective upgrade descriptions for more information.

If the wheelchair is reduced to 0 hitpoints, the wheelchair is not destroyed but the beacon becomes inert and will not respond to any commands until it is repaired over 1 hour with {@item tinker's tools} or with the {@spell mending|phb} cantrip.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Wild Magic "Wand"
entries: This odd bundle of loosly bound twigs from unknown, magical plants can be used in place of a wand.
This item has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.
When you use this wand to cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can expend any number of charges to gain a bonus to the spell's attack rolls. The bonus is equal to the number of charges expended.
Whenever charges are expended, you trigger a Wild Magic Surge.

item.name: Potion of Kobold Form
entries: When you drink this potion, you transform into a kobold for one hour. Your statistics remain the same except your appearance becomes that of a kobold, and you become a Small humanoid if you weren't already. Your equipment changes size with you, and if you were previously Medium or larger, you can ignore the Heavy property of weapons. You also the gain the Darkvision and Draconic Cry traits from the {@race kobold|mpmm} race.

item.name: Kobold Kake
entries: This messy but delicious cake has 8 portions. 10 minutes after a creature consumes a portion of the cake, it is subject to the effects of the {@item Potion of Kobold Form|J:Kobolds}. Consuming additional portions extends the duration of the effect by 1 hour for each additional portion.

item.name: Bag of Many Kobolds
entries: This small scaly bag appears to contain a collection of small, pointy teeth. As an action, you can pull up to two teeth from the bag and throw them each to an unocupied space you can see 15 feet. When a tooth lands, it transforms into a {@creature kobold warrior|J:Kobolds}. Once six teeth have been pulled from the bag, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.

The kobolds are friendly to you and your companions and go immediately after you in initiative. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. Each kobold vanishes after 1 hour, if they are ever more than 100 feet away from the bag, or if they drop to 0 hit points.

item.name: Primal Kobold Trinket
entries: If you use the Wild Shape feature from the Druid class or you cast the {@spell polymorph|phb} spell while holding this trinket, you can transform the target into a {@creature kobold|mm} rather than a beast. The target can speak any languages they knew previously but otherwise follow all the other rules of the feature or spell.

item.name: Ice Skates
entries: These special boots each feature a blade with which the wearer can glide over ice. You can don or doff these boots over 1 minute.

While wearing these boots, slippery ice is no longer considered {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for you but all other terrain is. In addition, if you are not travelling uphill, moving 2 feet on slippery ice only costs 1 foot of movement for you.

item.name: G��e Bulg
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

As an action, you can perform a special ranged attack with this weapon by kicking it towards a creature. On a hit, this weapon impales the creature and opens thirty barbs, making it very difficult to remove. While impaled, a creature takes {@dice 2d6} piercing damage for every 10 feet it travels. When used in this way, the G��e Bulg cannot be used for this type of attack again until the next dawn.

The G��e Bulg can be removed from an impaled creature, or its corpse, with either a DC 18 Strength (Athletics) or Wisdom (Medicine) check as an action. On a fail, the creature takes {@dice 4d6} piercing damage and the creature is still impaled. On a success, the creature takes half the damage and the G��e Bulg is removed.

item.name: Satyr's Wine
entries: This sweet wine is made by satyrs from forest fruits grown by dryads. When you drink this wine, you must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you become {@condition charmed} by all creatures that you can see of any species and gender you are normally attracted to. You can repeat the saving throw at the end of every hour until you succeed and are no longer {@condition charmed}.

item.name: Hourglass of Kronos
entries: This finely crafted hourglass holds one minute of sand and bears an engraving of a scythe on one side.
The hourglass has 2 charges and regains {@dice 1d3-1} charges daily at dawn.

While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell time stasis|J:General} spell (save DC 12) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 4th-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

item.name: Orb of Helios and Selene
entries: This tiny glass orb sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and shows an image of the sun, during the day, or the moon, during the night.
While holding this orb, you can use an action to read the image and determine whether it is morning, afternoon, evening, or nighttime outside. This property functions only on the Material Plane.

item.name: Sandals of the Styx
entries: These sandals have supposedly been dipped in the river styx at the border of the underworld and thus grant the wearer the powers of Achilles.
While wearing these sandals all non-magical weapon attacks against you have disadvantage.

entries.name: Curse
entries: These sandals are cursed. Attuning to them curses you until you are targeted by a spell such as {@spell remove curse} or a similar effect. While cursed, your attunement to the object cannot be broken, and any successful weapon attacks against you are treated as critical hits.

item.name: Bellerophon's Horn
entries: Once attuned to the horn you can blow it to summon a {@creature pegasus|mm}.
The pegasus is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the pegasus defends itself but takes no other actions.

When the pegasus drops to 0 hit points, it disappears in a cloud of mist, leaving behind no physical form, and cannot be summoned again until dawn the next dawn. You can also dismiss the pegasus at any time as an action, causing it to disappear in the same way.

item.name: Sandals of Atalanta
entries: While you are attuned to and wearing these sandals your walking speed increases by 10ft.

item.name: Wings of Daedalus
entries: While you are attuned to and wearing these wings you gain a flying speed of 30ft.

These wings require both arms to operate and so you cannot use your arms or hands whilst flying or hovering. Whilst on the ground, you can remove your arms from the contraption and use them normally while the wings hang uselessly off your back.

item.name: Helm of Darkness
entries: The helm has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn.
As an action, you can expend one charge to cast {@spell greater invisibility|phb} on yourself.

item.name: Nemean Lion Pelt
entries: While wearing this pelt, you have resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
This pelt cannot be worn over medium or heavy armor.

item.name: Spear of Kelphalos
entries: This weapon has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you miss a ranged attack with this weapon you can expend one charge to hit instead, this hit cannot be a critical hit.

item.name: Hippolyta's Girdle
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 21. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.
This item has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn.

As an action, you can expend one charge to cast the {@spell Enlarge/Reduce|phb} spell on yourself without providing material components. You have advantage on saving throws to maintain concentration for this casting.

item.name: Bolt of Zeus
entries: Crafted by the cyclopes, this crackling, golden bolt holds the power of zeus

This item has {@dice 3d4} charges when it is found. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell lightning bolt|phb} spell (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

If you expend the bolt's last charge roll a d20. On a 1, the bolt explodes and deals {@dice 8d6} lightning damage to all creatures within 10ft. If the roll is not a 1, the bolt crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Poppy of Hypnos
entries: When this poppy blooms, or takes damage, it releases a potent mist. All creatures within range are targeted by the {@spell sleep|phb} spell at 2nd level. The poppy then wilters and can not cast the spell again.

item.name: Molly
entries: This white flowering herb is known for protecting Odysseus from the witch Circe. Any creature that consumes the herb, is immune to the effects of the {@spell polymorph|phb}, {@spell true polymorph|phb} and {@spell mass polymorph|xge} spells for the next 8 hours.

item.name: Legionsbane Pistol
entries: This heavy steel pistol is the personal sidearm of Maximilian Steinhauser Von Stahlnich II, war hero and High Chancellor of Gaulsberg. It has seen many conflicts and seen much use.
You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
This weapon superheats bullets it fires, dealing an extra {@dice 2d6} fire damage on a hit.

{@b {@i Multi-Barrel.}} When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to make an additional attack with this weapon. This attack ignores the loading property of this weapon.

item.name: Grand Inquisitor's Baculus
entries: This black and silver halberd is a symbol of office for the Grand Inquisitor of the Caligos Imperium. While this weapon is mostly ceremonial, it is still a functional and formidable weapon.
You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
Once per turn, this weapon can channel the power of the Iuris Legion deal an extra {@dice 2d10} radiant damage on a hit.
When you make an attack with thise weapon, you can choose to make a normal melee attack or a ranged attack using the statistics of a {@item pepperbox pistol|Caligos}.

item.name: Inquisitor Mask
entries: This leather and metal mask features goggles and a beak is worn by members of the Inquisition within the Caligos Imperium.. While wearing this mask, you are immune to the {@condition blinded|phb} condition.

item.name: Inquisitor Coat
entries: This long, dark coat is worn by members of the Inquisition within the Caligos Imperium. You gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this cloak.

item.name: Inquisition Enforcer's Cane
entries: This elegant, black cane is topped with a metalic bird head and is wielded by members of the Inquisition within the Caligos Imperium. This particular cane was wielded by an Inquisition Enforcer.

As a bonus action you can transform this cane into a weapon of your choice with which you are proficient. The weapon can be any {@filter melee weapon that lacks the light and special properties|items|type=!futuristic;melee weapon;!modern;!treasure|property=!light;!special|miscellaneous=mundane}. You can transform it back into a cane with another bonus action.

item.name: Inquisition Officer's Cane
entries: This elegant, black cane is topped with a metalic bird head and is wielded by members of the Inquisition within the Caligos Imperium. This particular cane was wielded by an Inquisition Officer.

As a bonus action you can transform this cane into a weapon of your choice with which you are proficient. The weapon can be any {@filter melee weapon that lacks the two-handed and special properties|items|type=!futuristic;melee weapon;!modern;!treasure|property=!special;!two-handed|miscellaneous=mundane}. You can transform it back into a cane with another bonus action.

item.name: Inquisition Sharpshooter's Cane
entries: This elegant, black cane is topped with a metalic bird head and is wielded by members of the Inquisition within the Caligos Imperium. This particular cane was wielded by an Inquisition Sharpshooter.

As a bonus action you can transform this cane into a weapon of your choice with which you are proficient. The weapon can be any {@filter ranged weapon that lacks the special property|items|type=!futuristic;!modern;range;!treasure|property=!special|miscellaneous=mundane}. You can transform it back into a cane with another bonus action.

item.name: Chaotic Quiver of Tricks
entries: This quiver can hold up to 20 {@item arrow|phb|arrows} or {@item crossbow bolt|phb|bolts}.

As an action, you can touch this quiver and transform up to 4 pieces of nonmagical ammunition inside the quiver into a random piece of {@filter trick ammunition|items|source=j:ammo|type=ammunition} of the same base type. The ammunition remains magical until the next dawn, or until it hits a target. Once you use this action, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Chaotic Pouch of Tricks
entries: This pouch can hold up to 20 {@item sling bullet|phb|sling bullets}, {@item firearm bullet|J:Firearms|firearm bullets} or 50 {@item blowgun needle|phb|blowgun needles}.

As an action, you can touch this pouch and transform up to 4 pieces of nonmagical ammunition inside the pouch into a random piece of {@filter trick ammunition|items|source=j:ammo|type=ammunition} of the same base type. The ammunition remains magical until the next dawn, or until it hits a target. Once you use this action, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Quiver of Tricks
entries: This quiver can hold up to 20 {@item arrow|phb|arrows} or {@item crossbow bolt|phb|bolts}.

As an action, you can touch this quiver and transform up to 4 pieces of nonmagical ammunition inside the quiver into your choice of {@filter trick ammunition|items|source=j:ammo|type=ammunition} of the same base type. The ammunition remains magical until the next dawn, or until it hits a target. Once you use this action, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Pouch of Tricks
entries: This pouch can hold up to 20 {@item sling bullet|phb|sling bullets}, {@item firearm bullet|J:Firearms|firearm bullets} or 50 {@item blowgun needle|phb|blowgun needles}.

As an action, you can touch this pouch and transform up to 4 pieces of nonmagical ammunition inside the pouch into your choice of {@filter trick ammunition|items|source=j:ammo|type=ammunition} of the same base type. The ammunition remains magical until the next dawn, or until it hits a target. Once you use this action, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Primal Trinket (Ancient Root)
entries: This twisted root from an ancient and magical tree can be used to enhance your transformation abilities. When you use your Wild Shape feature whilst attuned to this item, you can have your Beast Form take on a more plant like appearance, such as having bark like skin or being covered in moss and flowers rather than hair. When you do so, your beast form is also altered in the following ways:

items: Your creature type becomes plant rather than beast.
You gain resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage.
You lose any resistance to slashing or fire, unless these resistances come from a source other than your beast form.
You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to initiate grapples while in beast form.

entries: Alternatively, if your DM allows, when you use your Wild Shape feature, you may choose to transform into a plant rather than a beast. Your new form still gains the effects described above. You must still abide by the other limitations of the feature and your new form cannot use any legendary actions, mythic actions or lair actions.

item.name: Primal Trinket (Divine Feather)
entries: This white and gold feather from the wing of a great celestial creature can be used to enhance your transformation abilities. When you use your Wild Shape feature whilst attuned to this item, you can have your Beast Form take on a more celestial appearance, such as pale hair or glowing eyes. When you do so, your beast form is also altered in the following ways:

items: Your creature type becomes celestial rather than beast.
You gain resistance to radiant and necrotic damage.
If your Wild Shape feature allows creatures with flying speeds at your current druid level, you gain a fly speed equal to your walking speed. You can also choose to grant your beast form wings.

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack in beast form, you can choose to either deal an additional {@dice 1d6} radiant damage to that creature or grant {@dice 1d6} temporary hit points to a creature you can see within 10 feet.

entries: Alternatively, if your DM allows, when you use your Wild Shape feature, you may choose to transform into a celestial rather than a beast. Your new form still gains the effects described above. You must still abide by the other limitations of the feature and your new form cannot use any legendary actions, mythic actions or lair actions.

trait.name: Formation Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, grappled, or restrained while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}), piercing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) blugeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Shape Up Maggots
entries: Whenever a friendly creature within 30 feet of the captain that can hear it misses with an attack, the captain can yell perilous threats to allow that creature to reroll the attack roll.

trait.name: Formation Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, grappled, or restrained while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hoplite makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}), piercing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hoplite makes two attacks with its longbow or kopis.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Serve the Master
entries: The warforged knows a humanoid creature as its master. The warforged must protect the master with its life, and must obey the master's every order, unless it directly threatens the life of the master.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warforged makes two armblade attacks.

action.name: Armblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Protect The Master
entries: When a creature makes an attack roll against the warforged's master and the warforged is able to reach them using their remaining movement, the warforged can use their reaction and their movement to block the incoming attack, taking the hit (or miss) themselves. The warforged's AC is used to determine if the attack hits or misses.

action.name: Final Protocol
entries: When all hope is lost, the warforged can perform one final act to hinder their enemies. The warforged can overload their core to explode.

Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the warforged must make a DC12 Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
This action kills the warforged and shatters their body into a thousand pieces.

reaction.name: Protection
entries: When an attacker the warforged can see makes an attack roll against a creature within 5 feet of the warforged, the warforged can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Warforged Horse
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the horse moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone|phb}. If the target is {@condition prone|phb}, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) blugeoning damage.

monster.name: Warforged Boar
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone|phb}.

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Warforged Dog
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone|phb}.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the jackalope can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Familiar
entries: With the DM's permission, the {@spell find familiar|phb} spell can summon a jackalope.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The jackalope has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Ventriloquy
entries: The jackalope can cast the {@spell minor illusion|phb} cantrip at will without providing somatic or material components. When it does so, the spell has a range of 60ft but it can only create voices and sounds. The jackalope's spell save DC for this casting is 16.

action.name: Antlers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Bad Flier
entries: The chicken falls at the end of a turn if it's airborne and the only thing holding it aloft is its flying speed.

trait.name: Headless
entries: If the chicken is reduced to 0 hit points by non-magical damage, it does not die immediately. Instead, it remains alive but headless for {@dice 1d4} rounds, or until it takes additional damage from any source. While headless, the chicken is {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, cannot use its peck attack, cannot restore hit points and must move at least 20ft in a random direction on each of its turns.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 slashing damage.

trait.name: Draconic Essence
entries: Choose a damage type; acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder. The chosen type determines the dragon's damage immunity and the damage type for several other traits.
If the dragon gains immunity to poison damage from this trait, it is recommended that it also gains immunity to the poisoned condition.

trait.name: Destructive Maw (Mauler Only)
entries: The dragon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage with its bite attack. The extra damage is of the type associated with the dragon's Draconic Essence trait.

trait.name: Enhanced Attacks (Mauler Only)
entries: The dragon has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with its bite attack.

trait.name: Enhanced Breath Weapons (Breathmaster Only)
entries: The dragon has +1 bonus to the DC for its breath weapons.
In addition, if the dragon can cast spells, it has a +1 bonus to its spell save DC.

trait.name: Enhanced Defence (Relentless Only)
entries: The dragon has a +1 bonus to its Armor Class and saving throws.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance (Relentless Only, Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If damage would reduce the dragon to 0 hit points, it instead drops to 1 hit point.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Dragon Breath
items.entry: The dragon exhales destructive energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage is of the type associated with the dragon's Draconic Essence trait.

items.name: Secondary Breath (Breathmaster Only)
entries: The dragon has a second breath weapon (chosen when the dragon is created) from the Secondary Breath Weapons table below.

When the dragon uses its secondary breath, it makes an exhalation in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} saving throw, the type of which is determined by the type of breath weapon. On failed save, a creature is subject to the associated effect shown in the table.

rows: On a failed save, the creature the creature is either {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened} (dragon's choice) for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition
On a failed save, the creature is moved 15 feet towards or away from the dragon (dragon's choice).
On a failed save, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success.

On a failed save, the creature the creature is either {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by the dragon (dragon's choice) for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success.
On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

On a failed save, the creature must subtract {@dice 1d6} from any attack rolls or ability checks it makes for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

variant.name: Custom Dragons
entries: This statblock is designed to be used to create dragons to fit your worlds and stories. You are encouraged to add your own flavor to each dragon you create, possibly even adding additional text to certain traits. For example, a dragon with Immobilizing Breath could be exhaling frost to freeze creatures in place, slowing time in the area or filling the area with an incapacitating toxin.

To add even more unique flair to a dragon, consider adding one or more {@filter additional draconic traits|optionalfeatures|source=erlw;jackalope;caligos;phb;tce;xge;jdragon|feature type=draconic traits}.

trait.name: Draconic Essence
entries: Choose a damage type; acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder. The chosen type determines the dragon's damage immunity and the damage type for several other traits.
If the dragon gains immunity to poison damage from this trait, it is recommended that it also gains immunity to the poisoned condition.

trait.name: Destructive Maw (Mauler Only)
entries: The dragon deals an extra {@dice 1d10} damage with its bite attack. The extra damage is of the type associated with the dragon's Draconic Essence trait.

trait.name: Enhanced Attacks (Mauler Only)
entries: The dragon has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with its bite and claw attacks.

trait.name: Enhanced Breath Weapons (Breathmaster Only)
entries: The dragon has +1 bonus to the DC for its breath weapons.
In addition, if the dragon can cast spells, it has a +1 bonus to its spell save DC.

trait.name: Enhanced Defence (Relentless Only)
entries: The dragon has a +1 bonus to its Armor Class and saving throws.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance (Relentless Only, Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If damage would reduce the dragon to 0 hit points, it instead drops to 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

items.name: Secondary Breath (Breathmaster Only)
entries: The dragon has a second breath weapon (chosen when the dragon is created) from the Secondary Breath Weapons table below.

When the dragon uses its secondary breath, it makes an exhalation in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} saving throw, the type of which is determined by the type of breath weapon. On failed save, a creature is subject to the associated effect shown in the table.

rows: On a failed save, the creature the creature is either {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened} (dragon's choice) for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition
On a failed save, the creature is moved 30 feet towards or away from the dragon (dragon's choice).
On a failed save, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success.

On a failed save, the creature the creature is either {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by the dragon (dragon's choice) for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success.
On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

On a failed save, the creature must subtract {@dice 1d6} from any attack rolls or ability checks it makes for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) and is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature {@condition grappled} in this way at a time.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 2d10 + 11}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Dragon Breath
items.entry: The dragon exhales destructive energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 84 ({@damage 13d12}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

trait.name: Fearless Defiance
entries: The kobold has advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition frightened} condition on itself.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kobold makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Amazon Huntress has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the Amazon Huntress hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Amazon Huntress makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Amazon Warrior has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the Amazon Warrior hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Amazon Warrior makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to makes a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Amazon Warrior adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Amazon Hoplite must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Doomerang
entries: You can cast the {@spell Boomerang Blade|Jackalope} cantrip at will using one of your pact weapons. When you do so the range of the attack is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Weapon
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.
Choose one of the following damage types when creating the weapon: acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison.

This weapon has 4 charges. When making a weapon attack with this weapon, you can expend one charge to deal an additional {@dice 1d6} of the chosen damage type. The weapon regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Agile Fighting
entries: All melee weapons that lack the heavy, two handed or special properties gain the finesse property when you wield them.

optionalfeature.name: Akimbo Shooting
entries: You can engage in two-weapon fighting even if one or both weapons are ranged. In addition, you do not need a hand free to load ammunition into ranged weapons (you still require two hands to use weapons with the two-handed property).

optionalfeature.name: Prone Fighting
entries: Being prone does not impose disadvantage on your attack rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Blast
entries: When you cast Eldritch Blast, you can change the damage type to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. If you cast multiple beams, you can choose the damage type of each beam individually.

optionalfeature.name: Wings of Flight

item: A Backpack, Cloak or Suit of Armor (requires attunement)

entries: This pair of wood, leather and metal wings grants the wearer a fly speed of 20ft, provided they are not wearing heavy armor. In addition, the wearer has advantage on Dexterity saving throws while being held aloft by these wings.
This fly speed increases to 30ft when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Tool

item: a set of artisan tools or a musical instrument

entries: This magic tool or instrument grants a +2 bonus to ability checks made using it.
This bonus increases to +4 when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Cavalier
entries: You can cast the {@spell find steed|phb} spell using a warlock spell slot.

If you use {@variantrule find steed variant|J:Steeds}, you can choose one of the {@filter new steeds|bestiary|source=j:steeds|miscellaneous=} when you take this invocation (Your DM may allow additional steeds).

optionalfeature.name: Alternative Abilty Scores
entries: Some dragons may find their power in the gathering of knowledge rather than the strength of their personality. For example, a papyrus dragon's greatest strength is its vast knowledge. As such, its Intelligence and Charisma scores are swapped to better reflect its nature.

Swap the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma score for that of a different ability from the same list.  The DC for the dragon's traits (excluding spellcasting) do not change as a result of theis trait.

optionalfeature.name: Alternative Creature Type
entries: Sometimes, just because it looks and acts like a dragon, doesn't mean it it actually is one. For example, a tree dragon's soul is bound to a specific tree and it is made of awakened wood. As such, its creature type is plant rather than dragon.
Change the dragon's creature type to another of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Bad Flier
entries: Not all dragons are good fliers, the dragon may have damaged wings or be inexperienced with them. For example, a cave dragon may have never had the space to properly utilize its wings, leading them to atrophy.
Half the dragon's flying speed and add the follwoing trait to the dragon's statblock:
{@b {@i Bad Flier.}} The dragon falls at the end of each of its turns if the only thing holding it aloft is its fly speed.

optionalfeature.name: Burrower
entries: Some dragons are adept at digging through loose earth. For example, a desert dragon can burrow through sand dunes as easily as it can walk on top of them.
Add a burrowing speed to the dragon's statblock equal to the dragon's walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Charming Presence
entries: Some dragon may be more alluring than terrifying. For example, a siren dragon might sing to charm those around it.
Creatures who fail the saving throw against the dragon's Frightful Presence trait are {@condition charmed} rather than {@condition frightened}.

optionalfeature.name: Climber
entries: Some dragons are adept at scaling vertical surfaces. For example, a ram dragon can traverse mountain cliffs as easily as gentle plains.
Add a climbing speed to the dragon's statblock equal to the dragon's walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Construct Design
entries: The dragon may have been constructed by magic or science, rather than born. Or perhaps it is composed primarily of inorganic matter. For example, a stone dragon is powered by magic rather than biology, and so is a contruct rather than a dragon.
Make the following changes to the dragon's statblock:

items: The dragon's creature's type is contruct rather than dragon.
The dragon is immune to poison and psychic damage.
The dragon is immune to disease and the {@condition poisoned} condition.
The dragon does not need to eat, drink, breathe or sleep and magic cannot put it to sleep.

optionalfeature.name: Diver
entries: Some dragons are adept at swimming. For example, a ram dragon can traverse mountain cliffs as easily as gentle plains.
Add a swimming speed to the dragon's statblock equal to the dragon's walking speed. Also, add the following trait:
{@b {@i Amphibious.}} The dragon can breathe air and water.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Mount
entries: For a multitude of reasons, a dragon may serve as the mount of another creature. For example, a cavalry dragon has bonded with a knight and the pair are a formidable force on the battlefield.
Add the following reaction to the dragon's statblock:
{@b {@i Protect Rider.}} When an attack would target a creature mounted on the dragon, the dragon can use a reaction to force the attack to target it instead.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Conduit
entries: You may decide that a dragon is not only unarmed by certain damage types but can channel the energy into its own attacks. For example, a lava dragon can absorb the heat from lava flows and direct it towards its enemies.
Add the following reaction to the dragon's statblock:

{@b {@i Energy Conduit.}} When the dragon would take damage of a type associated with its Draconic Essence trait, it can use a reaction to absorb part of the energy for a future attack. When the dragon next deals damage of the same type before the end of its next turn, it can deal an extra {@dice 2d6} damage of the same type.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Not all dragons trace their origin to the material plane. For example, a fairy dragon may trace their origin, at least in part, to the feywild
Make the following changes to the dragon's statblock:

items: The dragon's creature's type is fey rather than dragon.
The dragon is immune to the {@condition charmed} condition.
Magic cannot put the dragon to sleep.

optionalfeature.name: Grounded
entries: Not all dragons can fly, either losing the ability to do so or never having it to begin with. For example, a gladiator dragon may have had its wings removed as a wyrmling to prevent it escaping the arena.
Remove the dragon's base flying speed.

optionalfeature.name: Hidecarved
entries: Some dragons carve magical runes on their scales to improve their resilience. For example,
The dragon has one or more Hidecarved Wards, described in chapter 3 of Fizban's Treasury of Dragons.

optionalfeature.name: Immutable Form
entries: A dragon's physical form may be unchangeable. For example, an animated dragon statue cannot have its form physically changed.
Add the following trait to the dragon's statblock:
{@b {@i Immutable Form.}} The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

optionalfeature.name: Iron Will
entries: Some dragons posses extrodinary willpower, or none at all. For example, a zombie dragon is no longer truly conscious and cannot be manipulated.
The dragon is immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Minion Master
entries: Some dragons prefer to have underlings work for them. For example, many dragons may command {@creature kobolds|MM|kobold}, however, a forest dragon might command {@creature awakened tree|MM|awakened trees}, or a royal dragon might command dragonborn {@creature knight|MM|knights}.
Choose an appropriate creature that has a CR that is equal to or less than one third of the dragon's own CR. Then add the following action to the dragon's statblock:

{@b {@i Minion Master.}} {@dice 1d4+1} of the chosen creature appear in spaces within 30ft of the dragon. The summoned creatures act as a group immediately after the dragon's turn in initiative and will obey any commands given by the dragon (no action required). The creatures last until they die, are dismissed by the dragon (no action required) or the dragon uses this action again.
Additonally, if the dragon has legendary actions or lair actions, you can allow the dragon to use this trait as a legendary action or lair action.

optionalfeature.name: Multiple Heads
entries: Some dragons have multiple heads. For example, a medusa dragon has multiple serpent-like heads extending from its neck.
Add the following trait to the dragon's statblock:

{@b {@i Multiple Heads.}} The dragon can take one reaction per turn, rather than only one per round. It also has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Fangs
entries: Some dragons can utilize poison to make their attacks more danagerous. For example, an underdark dragon may drink {@item drow poison|dmg}, and deliver the poison to the target of its next bite attack.
Add the following bonus action to the dragon's statblock:

{@b {@i Poison Fangs.}} The dragon can use a bonus action to coat its teeth with poison (as if they were a melee weapon). The next time the dragon hits a creature with its bite attack, that creature is subject to the effects of the poison.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Caster
entries: A dragon may be able to perform magic quickly. For example, an iron dragon can use a legendary action to harden its hide by casting {@spell blade ward|phb} on itself.
Add the following legendary action to the dragon's statblock:

{@b {@i Quick Cast.}} The dragon casts a spell it knows that has a casting time of one action or one bonus action. The number of legendary actions expended is equal to the spell's level (1 for a cantrip).

optionalfeature.name: Secondary Essence
entries: Some dragons possess affinity for multiple forms of destructive energy. For example, a thermal dragon has mastery of heat, both producing and removing it. Both fire and cold damage are associated with its Draconic Essence trait.
Choose a second damage type for the dragon's Draconic Essence trait. When the dragon uses its Dragon Breath or Destructive Maw trait, it choses which of the damage types to deal.

optionalfeature.name: Signature Spellcaster
entries: A dragon might be especially talented at particular spells. For example, a spider dragon can cast the {@spell web|phb} spell at will.

Choose up to 2 spells of 3rd-level or lower. The dragon can cast these spells at will, without providing material components. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is the dragon's spellcasting ability (choose when you select this trait).

optionalfeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Some dragons posses innate magical talents. For example, a black hole dragon may know spells such as {@spell magnify gravity|egw} and {@spell gravity sinkhole|egw}. Meanwhile, a divine dragon may know spells such as {@spell cure wounds|phb} and {@spell greater restoration|phb}.

Choose a number of cantrips and spells up to the dragon's proficiency bonus. The maximum level of each spell known depends on the dragon's age; cantrips only for wyrmlings, 3rd-level or lower for young dragons, 5th-level or lower for adults, 7th-lower or lower for ancients and 9th-level or lower for greatwyrms.

For each spell of 1st-level or higher, the dragon can cast it once per day. The dragon does not need to provide material components for cantrips or spells that it casts. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is the dragon's spellcasting ability (choose when you select this trait).

optionalfeature.name: Telepathy
entries: Some dragons have telepathic abilities. For example, a psionic dragon can communicate with the minds of those around it.
Add the following trait to the dragon's statblock:
{@b {@i Telepathy.}} The dragon can speak telepathically with any other creature within 120ft.

optionalfeature.name: Unusual Size
entries: Some dragons are noticably larger or smaller than expected for their age. For example, a giant dragon may be significantly larger than normal dragons.
Increase or decrease the dragon's size category by one.

optionalfeature.name: Pact Gunsmith
entries: You can create a pact weapon that takes on the form of a firearm. The table below shows you which firearms you can create at each warlock level.

rows: {@item matchlock musket|J:Firearms}, {@item matchlock pistol|J:Firearms}, {@item wheellock musket|J:Firearms}, {@item wheellock pistol|J:Firearms}

entries: Additionally, you can transform any magical firearm into your pact weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Shield
entries: Your patron gives you a special pact shield, which you can summon to an empty hand as an action. You choose the appearance and material of the shield when you create it, and it grants you a bonus to your AC equal to your proficiency bonus when you wield it, unless it is a magic shield that already grants you a higher bonus. You are proficient with the shield, and you cannot be disarmed of it against your will.

Your pact shield disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the shield (no action required), or if you die.

You can transform a magic shield you find into your pact shield by performing a ritual over the course of an hour. This ritual can be done during a short or long rest. The shield then appears whenever you summon your pact shield thereafter. You can't affect an artifact or a sentient shield in this way. The shield ceases being your pact shield if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different shield, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The shield appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Pact Shield
entries: You can use your pact shield as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.
Additionally, you can summon the shield to your empty hand as a reaction to being targeted by an attack. The AC bonus granted by the shield can be used against the triggering attack.

optionalfeature.name: Guardian Shield
entries: If a creature other than you that you can see within 30 feet is targeted by an attack roll, and you are wielding your pact shield, you can use a reaction to teleport to a space adjacent to them and add the AC boost granted by the shield to the creature's AC until the start of your next turn. This effect ends early if the creature is ever more than 5 feet away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Oversized Shield
entries: As an action, you can grow your shield up to 10ft tall and wide and plant it in the ground. Any creatures behind the shield can use it for cover as if it were a solid wall. While in this form, you can not move the shield, and it is treated as an object with an AC equal to 14 + your proficiency bonus and a number of hit points equal to five times your proficiency bonus. The shield will remain in place for 1 minute or until it is reduced to 0 hit points, after which it disappears. It disappears early if you summon it back to your hand at its regular size or until it disappears by the normal rules of pact shields.

optionalfeature.name: Feather Shield
entries: When you fall while holding your pact shield, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling. You can allow other creatures, that are your size or smaller, to hold onto you and slow their own descent in the same manner.

optionalfeature.name: Immovable Shield
entries: You can cast the {@spell Immovable Object|egw} spell on your pact shield using a warlock spell slot. You do not provide material components when you do so.

optionalfeature.name: Floating Shield
entries: You can cast the {@spell Tenser's Floating Disk|phb} spell at will without expending a spell slot or providing material components. When you do so, your pact shield becomes the disk. The spell ends early if you summon the shield back to your hand.

optionalfeature.name: Offensive Shield
entries: Your pact shield becomes a melee weapon with the finesse, light and thrown properties with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. You are proficient with attacks with the shield. The shield's damage die for attacks is a {@dice d6}, and the attacks deal bludgeoning damage. You also gain the following benefits.

items: Attacks with the shield count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
When you make a ranged attack using the shield, the shield returns to your hand immediately after the attack.
If you make a critical hit with the shield, you may immediately make an additional attack with the shield.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Shield
entries: Choose one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, radiant or thunder. While wielding your pact shield, you are resistant to the chosen damage type.
In addition, when a creature hits you with a melee attack while you are wielding your pact shield, you can use a reaction to deal {@dice 1d6} damage of the chosen type to them.

entries.name: Deep Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison and cold damage.

entries.name: Depth Diver
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Ocean Dwarf Combat Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item spear|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item net|phb}, and {@item warhammer|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, such as ancient columns or statues, you are considered proficient in the {@skill History} skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: A typical cannon is between two and three years old. The maximum cannon lifespans remains a mystery; so far, cannons have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most cannons take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and��neutrality. But some have absorbed the morality, or lack thereof, of the beings with which they served.

entries.name: Size
entries: Cannons stand just over 2 feet tall and average about 20 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common. You can also speak using your Machine Speech trait.

entries.name: Machine Speech
entries: Machine Speech is a series of beeps at varying pitch and length. At the DM's discretion, certain other creatures may understand or speak this language.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance to {@condition poison|phb} damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest.
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious|phb}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Natural Armor.
entries: Due to the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor and gain no benefit from wearing it. Your body provides ample protection, however; your base armor class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Force Ballista.
entries: You know the {@spell Tin's Force Ballista|Jackalope} cantrip.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this cantrip when you cast it with this trait (choose when you select this race).
Eldritch Cannons are the living weapons of artificers. Most are simple unthinking machines but, in rare circumstances, a cannon may gain sentience and free will, becoming an Awakened Cannon.
Cannons come in all manner of sizes and shapes, despite this, they are treated as humanoids and are capable of all the actions of typical humanoids.

entries.name: Age
entries: A halfling reaches adulthood at the age of 20 and generally lives into the middle of his or her second century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Unlike most halflings, leprechauns are often mischievous and chaotic in nature.

entries.name: Size
entries: Halflings average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Halfling. The Halfling language isn't secret, but halflings are loath to share it with others. They write very little, so they don't have a rich body of literature. Their oral tradition, however, is very strong. Almost all halflings speak Common to converse with the people in whose lands they dwell or through which they are traveling.

entries.name: Fey
entries: Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Lucky
entries: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

entries.name: Little Cobbler
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item cobbler's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Pot O' Gold
entries: You have access to a personal demiplane in which you can store treasure. As an action you can transfer a tiny, non-magical object, or up to 50 coins, from your hand to the demiplane. The demiplane can hold up to five pounds of non-magical objects (coins do not count towards this limit). While in the demiplane, the contents weigh nothing and can only be retrieved by you as an action. When you are reduced to 0 hit points, the contents spill out into a space within 5ft. of you.

entries.name: Fey
entries: Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself.

entries.name: Wild Spirit
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft|phb} cantrip.

entries.name: Dryad Magic
entries: You can cast the {@spell animal friendship|phb}, {@spell charm person} and {@spell entangle} spells with this trait and without material components. Once you cast any of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

Dryads are the spirits of trees manifested in near humanoid form, typically with a feminine appearance. They are often found has protectors of woodland areas, overseeing the trees and beasts and protecting them from encroaching wildfires, hunters and deforestation.

Dryads souls are tied to the trees they spawn from. Maturing, aging and typical lifespans vary between dryads and between regions in the multiverse. In some places each dryad's life force is directly tied to a specific tree, they mature age and die along with the tree and vice versa. In others, the connection is more indirect, with their lifespans mimicking the species they spawn from. For example, a weeping willow dryad might live only a few decades, while an oak dryad might live several centuries.

entries.name: Dryads across the multiverse
entries: In Cyranos in Alvergia, they are often found in tribes led by a queen and are known to mingle with tribes of satyrs, centaurs and wood elves. Dryads are also found frequently on the Isle of Pan.
In Caligos, dryads are often seen as a chaotic people and distrusted in the Caligos Imperium. Many feel safer and more comfortable in Sudenberg, which is friendlier to nature and chaos.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid. You are also considered an elf for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be an elf.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on yourself.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Radiant Resistance
entries: You have resistance to radiant damage.

entries.name: Divine Dash
entries: As a bonus action, you can rapidly move up to 30 feet in a straight line in any direction. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks and you can pass through the space of other creatures. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

When you reach 3rd level, you can enhance your Divine Dash trait at the end of a long rest with an additional effect from the list below. The effect lasts until the end of your next long rest. If the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this race):

items.name: Forceful Dash.
items.entry: Any creatures who's space you pass through, and that are your size or smaller, must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Healing Dash.
items.entry: Any creatures who's space you pass through regain a number of hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Radiant Dash.
items.entry: Any creatures who's space you pass through take radiant damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you remain conscious.

Whenever you finish this trance, you can change the effect for your Divine Dash trait, and you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you finish your next long rest.

Just as many elves have their origins from the feywild, celestial elves instead claim similar from the upper planes and from celestial beings or even gods. Infused with divine and positive energies, celestial elves can propel themselves forward with the speed and strength of divine gods, unhindered by those in their way.

In Cyranos, some of these elves trace their lineage directly back to the first elves created by Prometheus and Athena. Some may even claim godly ancestry, being descended from demi-gods or even being demi-gods in their own right. This can be a source of great pride for many, perhaps too much for some. It can also be the source of great expectations and the stress of living up to them.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid. You are also considered an elf for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be an elf.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on yourself.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Necrotic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Revenant Dash
entries: As a bonus action, you can rapidly move up to 30 feet in a straight line in any direction. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks and you can pass through the space of other creatures. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

When you reach 3rd level, you can enhance your Revenant Dash trait at the end of a long rest with an additional effect from the list below. The effect lasts until the end of your next long rest. If the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this race):

items.name: Darkness Dash.
items.entry: You become {@condition invisible} until the end of the current turn. The effect ends early if you make an attack or cast a spell.

items.name: Fearful Dash.
items.entry: Any creatures who's space you pass through must make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of their next turn.
